etymology.description: 木(木) (mù, "wood") + 午(午) (wǔ, "pestle") = wooden pestle -> pestle
etymology.interpretation: The character 杵(杵) (chǔ, "pestle") combines the semantic element 木(木) (mù, "wood") with the phonetic element 午(午) (wǔ, "pestle"), indicating a wooden pestle. The use of 木(木) signifies the material from which a pestle is traditionally made, while 午(午) provides the phonetic clue.

examples.chinese: 他用杵捣碎大蒜(他用杵搗碎大蒜)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng chǔ dǎo suì dàsuàn.
examples.english: He uses the pestle to crush garlic.

examples.chinese: 她挥动杵磨面(她揮動杵磨麵)，准备做传统糕点(準備做傳統糕點)。
examples.pinyin: Tā huī dòng chǔ mó miàn, zhǔn bèi zuò chuántǒng gāo diǎn.
examples.english: She swings the pestle to grind flour, preparing to make traditional pastries.

examples.chinese: 古人以杵研药(古人以杵研藥)，制成药丸(制成藥丸)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ rén yǐ chǔ yán yào, zhì chéng yào wán.
examples.english: Ancient people used the pestle to grind medicine, and made pills out of it.
